Making text subtitle for the t-test (between-/within-subjects designs).

Source: R/helpers_ggbetween_subtitles.R
subtitle_t_parametric.Rd

Making text subtitle for the t-test (between-/within-subjects designs).

subtitle_t_parametric(data, x, y, paired = FALSE, effsize.type = "g",
  effsize.noncentral = FALSE, conf.level = 0.95, var.equal = FALSE,
  k = 3, ...)

Arguments

data

Dataframe from which variables specified are preferentially to be taken.
x

The grouping variable.
y

The response - a vector of length the number of rows of x.
paired

a logical indicating whether you want a paired t-test.
effsize.type

Type of effect size needed for parametric tests. The argument can be "biased" ("d" for Cohen's d for t-test; "partial_eta" for partial eta-squared for anova) or "unbiased" ("g" Hedge's g for t-test; "partial_omega" for partial omega-squared for anova)).
effsize.noncentral

Logical indicating whether to use non-central t-distributions for computing the confidence interval for Cohen's d or Hedge's g (Default: FALSE). @param conf.level A scalar value between 0 and 1. If unspecified, the default is to return 95% lower and upper confidence intervals (0.95).
conf.level

confidence level of the interval.
var.equal

a logical variable indicating whether to treat the variances in the samples as equal. If TRUE, then a simple F test for the equality of means in a one-way analysis of variance is performed. If FALSE, an approximate method of Welch (1951) is used, which generalizes the commonly known 2-sample Welch test to the case of arbitrarily many samples.
k

Number of digits after decimal point (should be an integer) (Default: k = 3).
...

Additional arguments (ignored).

Examples


# creating a smaller dataset
msleep_short <- dplyr::filter(
  .data = ggplot2::msleep,
  vore %in% c("carni", "herbi")
)

# with defaults
subtitle_t_parametric(
  data = msleep_short,
  x = vore,
  y = sleep_rem
)
#> paste(italic("t"), "(", c(df = "10.888"), ") = ", c(t = "1.494"), 
#>     ", ", italic("p"), " = ", "0.164", ", ", italic("g"), " = ", 
#>     c(carni = "0.716"), ", 95% CI [", "-0.071", ", ", "1.503", 
#>     "]", ", ", italic("n"), " = ", 34L)

# changing defaults
subtitle_t_parametric(
  data = msleep_short,
  x = vore,
  y = sleep_rem,
  var.equal = TRUE,
  k = 2,
  effsize.type = "d"
)
#> paste(italic("t"), "(", c(df = "32.00"), ") = ", c(t = "1.95"), 
#>     ", ", italic("p"), " = ", "0.060", ", ", italic("d"), " = ", 
#>     c(carni = "0.73"), ", 95% CI [", "-0.05", ", ", "1.52", "]", 
#>     ", ", italic("n"), " = ", 34L)
